channel.title: Itemspecialvalues
channel.description: Okay so I want to have two different stores with special values but they have the same items in them. Is there a way I could make ti so the values would recognize a different price?

item.title: Itemspecialvalues
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

In your ShopAssistant class, add this import

import server.model.players.PlayerAssistant;
And under public int getItemValue, add this:

[code=java]

public int getSpecialItemValue2(int id) {
switch (id) {
case ITEM:
return PRICE;
}
return 0;
}[/code]
Then under the handleOtherShop method, add this:

if (c.myShopId == SHOPID) { if (c.POINTTYPE >= getSpecialItemValue2(itemID)) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){ c.POINTTYPE -= getSpecialItemValue2(itemID); c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1); c.getItems().resetItems(3823); } } else { c.sendMessage("You do not have enough points to buy this item."); } }
I haven’t tested it, but it might work.

Read full topic
